snippet.title: Tokimeki Memorial (PC Engine CD) - Intro (Take your Chance!)
snippet.description:
Intro of "Tokimeki Memorial" on the PC Engine CD/Turbografx CD - Take your chance!.

“Tokimeki Memorial” is a dating sim created by Konami’s Tokyo division and released for the PC Engine Super CD-Rom^2 in 1994.
Also known as “Tokimemo”, this title represents an absolute milestone among the dating sims, as it played a key role in the popularization of the genre in Japan.
Over a few years after its release, "Tokimeki Memorial" was ported to most of the main gaming platforms of the time, such as Playstation, Saturn, PC and Super Famicom.
In this simulator, you play as a high-school student, who must win the heart of his long-lost childhood friend, namely the beatiful Shiori Fujisaki, or another girl's one, within 3 years.
The most distinctive feature from "Tokimeki Memorial" consists in the “Bomb System”, which encourages you to date all the girls on hand with some sort of balance.
Other than dealing with your dates, you have to devote yourself to your homework and other activities aimed at the protagonist’s growth, and occasionally you're going to face some minigames.
Unfortunately, none of the versions of "Tokimeki Memorial" has ever been translated from the Japanese, not even by fans, and the language barrier is very high.
Over the years, the game received countless sequels and spin-offs, and in 2020 Konami included it on the library of the Japanese version of the PC Engine/Turbografx Mini console.

Channel Presentation: http://y2u.be/BE9yFzjDOIM
